Authors: zhang Fa, Yang xiao-yan, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Fusarium xiangyunensis (Nectriaceae), a remarkable new
species of nematophagous fungi from Yunnan, China.
Keywords:
Adhesive microconidia, Endoparasitic nematodes, New
species, Phylogeny
Abstract:
Fusarium xiangyunensis sp. nov., isolated from a
hot-spring waterlogged soil, China is described and illustrated as an
endoparasitic fungus of nematodes. Evidence for the new species is
provided by morphological and phylogenetic analyses using ITS, EF1-Î± and
RPB1 sequence data. Phylogenetic analyses show that F. xiangyunensis
clustered in one clade with those species belong to F. solani species
complex (FSSC) and is grouped together with F. witzenhausenense. In
morphology, this species is different from F. witzenhausenense in host
occurrence, conidia and chlamydospores. Furthermore, the nematicidal
activity shows that its microconidia cause the infection and dead of
nematodes in both sterile water and solid medium. Therefore, we
introduce F. xiangyunensis as a novel species with a description and its
nematicidal activity.
